page.title: 01DALRY(KIRK):A SCOTS VILLAGE
page.content: St.John's Town of Dalry, in the Stewartry of Kirkudbright, is a small attractive village in the Glenkens,the valley of the River Ken, in rural Galloway.It is farming country. Westward rise the Rhinns of Kells; to the south there is the Solway coast. The area is unspoilt by 'development'. Dalry's two principal streets run uphill to join at the top of Main St., which is part of the A702 terminating in Edinburgh.Throughgate joins them lower down to form the crossbar of an 'A' whose base stands on the A713 Ayr to Castle Douglas road.There is a standing stone of great antiquity in a nearby field, a 12th. century motte and other historical monuments. The Post Office and grocers shops serve a wide geographical area.Those fortunate enough to live in Dalry work hard to maintain its beauty.
